Html:
I cannot get my local PHP app to send email to SMTP4DEV, so I am trying to see if SMTP4DEV works using telnet. 

As soon as I issue a "HELO" statement it crashes.  If I send a "RCPT TO: (address)" it tells me, "501 Must specify to address <address>" no matter what email address I give it.

Is this a problem with Windows 7?  I have even tried running it in Windows XP compatibility mode.

Thanks.

Nope, it works just fine in Wndows 7 here.

Hope that helps track down your issue.

Tim

tomsimon wrote:

I cannot get my local PHP app to send email to SMTP4DEV, so I am trying to see if SMTP4DEV works using telnet. 

As soon as I issue a "HELO" statement it crashes.  If I send a "RCPT TO: (address)" it tells me, "501 Must specify to address <address>" no matter what email address I give it.

Is this a problem with Windows 7?  I have even tried running it in Windows XP compatibility mode.

Hi

Thanks for reporting this issue.
Please can you post the session log ("sessions" tab then click "view log").

Thanks
Rob

I see what tomsimon saw in Windows 7.

I fixed it by updating my local test website to enclose the RCPT TO address in angle brackets.
